Name: Sina Farsiu
Title: Paul Ruffin Scarborough Associate Professor of Engineering
Description: Research Interests: Focused on medical imaging and machine learning to improve the overall health and vision outcome of patients with ocular and neurological diseases (e.g., age-related macular degeneration, diabetic retinopathy, Alzheimer, and ALS) through earlier and personalized therapy.

Name: Yiyang Gong
Title: Assistant Professor in the Department of Biomedical Engineering
Description: Research Interests: Recording and understanding brain activity by developing novel combinations of optical microscopy and genetically encoded sensors. Using these technologies, we wish to dissect neural circuit function and investigate how neural activity drives complex behaviors.

Name: Joseph A. Izatt
Title: Michael J. Fitzpatrick Professor of Engineering in the Edmund T. Pratt, Jr. School of Engineering
Description: Research Interests: Biophotonics and include coherence-based biomedical imaging and microscopy, novel technologies for ophthalmic imaging, and nanoscale studies of cellular morphology and dynamics.

Name: David F. Katz
Title: Nello L. Teer, Jr. Professor of Biomedical Engineering, in the Edmund T. Pratt, Jr. School of Engineering
Description: Research Interests: Methods for prophylaxis against STD's, emphasizing topical microbicides and contraception; biofluid mechanics; rheology and transport phenomena; biophysical aspects of mammalian sperm motility, sperm transport, and fertilization; and biomechanical functioning of the vitreous of...

Name: Kathryn Radabaugh Nightingale
Title: Theo Pilkington Professor of Biomedical Engineering
Description: Research Interests: Ultrasonic and elasticity imaging, specifically nonlinear propagation, acoustic streaming and radiation force; the intentional generation of these phenomena for the purpose of tissue characterization; finite element modeling of normal and diseased tissue when exposed to...

Name: Mark L. Palmeri
Title: Associate Professor of the Practice in the Department of Biomedical Engineering
Description: Research Interests: Ultrasonic imaging, specifically using acoustic radiation force to characterize the mechanical properties of tissue, and finite element analysis of soft tissue response to impulsive radiation force excitation. Other research interests include ultrasonic bioeffects and mechanical...

Name: Nimmi Ramanujam
Title: Robert W. Carr, Jr., Professor of Biomedical Engineering
Description: Research Interests: Innovating on optical strategies to peer into the biological landscape of thick tissues. Technologies being developed in her lab leverage principles of optical spectroscopy, optical sectioning microscopy, and molecular imaging. Her research group is developing and applying these...

Name: Gregg E. Trahey
Title: Robert Plonsey Professor of Biomedical Engineering
Description: Research Interests: Medical ultrasound, image guided surgery, adaptive imaging, imaging of tissue's mechanical properties, and radiation force imaging.

Name: Tuan Vo-Dinh
Title: R. Eugene and Susie E. Goodson Professor of Biomedical Engineering
Description: Research Interests: Biophotonics, laser-excited luminescence spectroscopy, room temperature phosphorimetry, synchronous luminescence spectroscopy, surface-enhanced Raman spectroscopy, field environmental instrumentation, fiberoptics sensors, nanosensors, biosensors and biochips for the protection...

Name: Olaf T. Von Ramm
Title: Thomas Lord Professor of Engineering in the Edmund T. Pratt, Jr. School of Engineering
Description: Research Interests: Diagnostic ultrasound imaging systems, IR imaging, medical instrumentation and their new applications.

Name: Adam P. Wax
Title: Professor of Biomedical Engineering
Description: Research Interests: Optical spectroscopy for early cancer detection, novel microscopy and interferometry techniques.

Name: Patrick D. Wolf
Title: Associate Professor of Biomedical Engineering
Description: Research Interests: Advanced instrumentation for diagnosis and treatment of electrophysiological problems. This research covers two primary organ systems: the heart and the brain. In the heart, Dr. Wolf is developing an image guided ablation system for treatment of arrhythmias. In the brain, he is...

Name: Junjie Yao
Title: Assistant Professor of Biomedical Engineering
Description: Research Interests: Photoacoustic tomography (PAT) technologies, and translating PAT advances into diagnostic and therapeutic applications, especially in functional brain imaging and early cancer theranostics.

Name: Alexandra Badea
Title: Associate Professor in Radiology
Description: Research Interests: Brain Imaging, MRI, Connectivity, Multivariate Biomarkers, Image Analysis, Neurological Conditions, Alzheimer's Disease

Name: Louis Edwin DeFrate
Title: Frank H. Bassett III, M. D. Associate Professor

Name: Mark Wesley Dewhirst
Title: Gustavo S. Montana Professor of Radiation Oncology, in the School of Medicine
Description: Research Interests: Dr. Dewhirst's research interests focus on the tumor microenvironment and how it influences treatment responses. Areas of particular focus are hypoxia, acidosis, angiogenesis and oxidative stress.

Name: James T. Dobbins
Title: Professor in Radiology
Description:
Research Interests: The research in my laboratory focuses on three main areas:  (1) advanced imaging applications to improve diagnostic accuracy in clinical imaging, (2) the scientific assessment of image quality, and (3) developing lower cost imaging for the developing world.

Name: Anthony Nanlin Kuo
Title: Associate Professor of Ophthalmology

Name: Ehsan Samei
Title: Professor of Radiology
Description: Research Interests: Methods to develop image quality and dose metrics that are clinically relevant and that can be used to design and utilize advanced imaging techniques towards precise interpretive and quantitative performance.

Name: Guillermo Sapiro
Title: James B. Duke Professor of Electrical and Computer Engineering
Description: Research Interests: Image and video processing, computer vision, computer graphics, computational vision, biomedical imaging, brain imaging, cryo-tomography of viruses, computational tools in cryo-tomography, computational tools in early diagnosis of psychiatric disorders, differential geometry and...

Name: William Paul Segars
Title: Associate Professor in Radiology
Description: Research Interests: Computer-generated phantoms and simulation techniques to investigate and optimize medical imaging systems and methods; development of computational models of patients and imaging devices.

Name: Allen Wuming Song
Title: Professor in Radiology
Description: Research Interests: Song's research program is centered on high-resolution MRI methodological development to best depict and detect human brain structure and function.

Name: Martin Paul Tornai
Title: Associate Professor of Radiology

Name: Cynthia Ann Toth
Title: Joseph A.C. Wadsworth Professor of Ophthalmology
Description: Research Interests: Translational research and early-application clinical trials with a focus on novel retinal imaging with spectral domain and swept source optical coherence tomography (SD and SSOCT)

Name: Michael Rod Zalutsky
Title: Jonathan Spicehandler, M.D. Professor of Neuro Oncology, in the School of Medicine
Description: Research Interests: The development of novel radioactive compounds for improving the diagnosis and treatment of cancer.

Name: Cameron R. Bass
Title: Associate Research Professor of Biomedical Engineering
Description: Research Interests: Dr. Bass's research interests include the biomechanics of blast, blunt and ballistic trauma and pediatric trauma. His research focuses on injury risk from microscale to macroscale for the head, neck, thorax and extremities.

Name: Paolo F Maccarini
Title: Assistant Research Professor of the Department of Biomedical Engineering
Description: Research Interests: By merging advanced circuit/antenna design with multiphysics modeling, Dr. Maccarini pioneered low-cost passive sensors to noninvasively measure deep temperature for various diagnostic applications. By combining novel engineering solutions with immunotherapy/thermo-drugs, his...

Name: Stephen William Smith
Title: Professor Emeritus of Biomedical Engineering
Description: Research Interests: Current research interests are the development and evaluation of improved medical ultrasound image quality for applications in cardiology, radiology and obstetrics.
